It's not so much about her not being a virgin per se, but her not being a virgin despite having promised to marry him. She loved him enough to never have forgotten the promise and show up at the exact appointed time apparently without having communicated before, but she didn't love him enough to not run off to other guys before while he did wait for her. It's unfair and it's a shitty thing to do. You can cry incel all you want, but women and men value sex differently and you simply will not get how shitty it must feel for him to have fooled around while he saved himself for her. There's absolutely nothing wrong with a woman not being a virgin, but they promised and she just didn't care enough for waiting on the physical part, because women value things differently. A lot of women think it doesn't matter how much they fool around because "what matters is love and who they end up with in the end", which, again, would be okay normally, but...
